page.title: 08SUPERNATURAL.
page.content: Outside Mid Kirk Church, between the church and the drinking well, there is a horse shoe in the ground. The shoe was put there to bring luck to the church. However, instead of pointing towards the church, thus pouring good luck into it, it is pointing towards the River Clyde taking the good luck away from the church. Many children sometimes play a dangerous game with a ouji board, calling up the spirits of the dead. One such group succeeded but contacted a 'bad' spirit which held them in a trance. Luckily, the door bell of the house was rung and broke the spell but the girl who went to answer the door fell down the stairs. When questioned about this she said she had felt a hand pushing her.
